content:
I'm glad to hear that Billy and Whiskers are enjoying the clean water! It's great that you've noticed an improvement in their behavior and water intake since replacing the old trough. Clean water is essential for their overall health, and a good filter can make a big difference.

Regarding the hay, it's excellent that you're considering the protein needs of both your horses and goats. A mix of hay that meets both their needs will help ensure they're getting the nutrients they require. Just remember to monitor their behavior, appetite, and overall health, and adjust the hay mix as needed.

As you're taking care of your horses and goats, don't forget to also provide them with adequate shelter, social interaction, and regular veterinary check-ups. It's wonderful that you're taking such good care of them!

By the way, I'm curious - how did you come up with the names Billy and Whiskers for your goats? Do they have any unique personalities or quirks that inspired their names?
